The '1st Marine Division' is a Marine infantry division of the United States
Marine Corps headquartered at Marine Corps Base Camp Pendleton, California. It
is a subordinate unit of the I Marine Expeditionary Force (I MEF).

It is the oldest and largest active duty division in the United States Marine
Corps, representing a combat-ready force of more than 19,000 men and women. It
is one of three active duty divisions in the Marine Corps today and is a multi-
role, expeditionary ground combat force. It is nicknamed "The Old Breed".
